projects.title: Klik
projects.subtitle: klik group landing page
projects.description: This is an static website design only for desktop, it's not responsive, as an introduction to our team and our state of mind, the goal is to learn how to use html5 and css3 without any javascript function. We look for a simple and elegant design made in figma based on a template.
projects.team: Sergio Corcuera, María Alexandra Galarza, Berta López, Gabriela Piñeiro, Joan Recordà.

projects.title: Sombrerería Mil
projects.subtitle: online catalog for a hat store
projects.description: This is an static web page, a catalogue that sells hats for both women and men, it's for a traditional and antique store in Barcelona, it's responsive and made with html5, css3 and javascript. The page it's not finished and the responsive is missing, only works well in devices of 375 x 812 pixels.
projects.team: Sergio Corcuera, María Alexandra Galarza, Berta López, Gabriela Piñeiro, Joan Recordà.

projects.title: Wheel of Doom
projects.subtitle: randomly system of selecting sacrifices app
projects.description: The goal of the Wheel of Doom is to create a fair and random sacrifice selection system for coders, like a videogame, it's intented to kill players. It's responsive and made with html5, css3 and with a minimum of 4 functions of javascript including audio and animation.
projects.team: Sergio Corcuera, María Alexandra Galarza, Berta López, Gabriela Piñeiro, Joan Recordà.

projects.title: Handy App
projects.subtitle: Appointments from coders to CTO app
projects.description: Handy App allows workers from the company to request an appointment with the CTO to solve technical problems of the development team. The CTO can see all the appoitments required from de coders and the coders can manipulate their request information. The user securities are not implemented yet. It was made with HTML5, CSS3, Sass, PHP, Figma, MySql, PHPMyAdmin-PDO.
projects.team: Sergio Corcuera, María Alexandra Galarza, Berta López, Gabriela Piñeiro, Joan Recordà.

projects.title: Agorax Events
projects.subtitle: online events management app
projects.description: This app has been created to manage online events such as workshops, masterclasses or webinars. Users can view the description of an event, sign up and unsubscribe. They can also see the list of events they have signed up for. The administrator has the tools to manage the events, he/she can create, edit and delete them as well as being saved in a history page. MVC architecture and technologies used were PHP 7.4, Laravel 8.0, Auth, Blade, Bootstrap, MySql.
projects.team: Leah Calafell, María Alexandra Galarza, Martín Madridejos, Armando Mago, Snezhanna Stefanova.

projects.title: KlikShare
projects.subtitle: everything donation app
projects.description: This is an app for donation, it works like an e-commerce but with the difference that it doesn't have a payment gateway. People can donate any kind of articles but at the same time can reserve articles that wants to receive. The user wins klikcoins for the donations they make, and can be accumulative, and they can exchange for rewards. This app has two repositories, one for front-end and another for back-end. It´s not deployed and the front consumes the back by API's using token to be able to validate users. MVC architecture and technologies used were PHP 7.4, Laravel 8.0, MySql, Bootstrap, Vue.js
projects.team: Solomon Chukwuka, María Alexandra Galarza, Armando Mago, Jose Miguel Quesada, David Sánchez, Andrea Súarez.

projects.title: Hangar Rebelde
projects.subtitle: e-commerce for a Comic Store
projects.description: Application created to meet the growing sales demand of a comics store located in Oviedo - Spain, which saw its sales increase significantly during the pandemic. It needs to create a solid and scalable application, initially to cover its online store functionality and in the future to complement the other online services that Hangar Rebelde offers. MVC architecture and technologies used were PHP 7.4, Laravel 8.0, Auth, Blade, Bootstrap, Sass, Stripe (API), MySql, PHPUnit for TDD and unit test.
projects.team: Gabriela Baquerizo, María Alexandra Galarza, Cris Mouta, Jose Miguel Quesada, David Sánchez, Snezhanna Stefanova.

projects.title: Star Wars App
projects.subtitle: star wars ships search website
projects.description: This is a website that let you find a list of ships that belongs to the Star Wars saga, it's developed with react.js and it's consuming the Starwars API https://swapi.dev/api/starships with Axios requests and from a service and also gets the list paginated. It has two users, a normal one who can access to the home page and a premium who can access to the the list of ships and the detailed page of each ship including the films in which it has appeared and the pilots who have flown it, the authorization it's using the localStorage, for now.

projects.title: Dessert Scrapbook
projects.subtitle: recipe search website
projects.description: This is a website that let you search for sweet food recipes, it's developed with react.js and it's consuming the Edamam API https://www.edamam.com/ with Axios requests and from a service. It's using react-router-dom v.6 for navigate between pages. It has two users, a normal one who can access to the searcher for recipes and a premium who can access to the specific dessert and can have the link to the entire recipe, the authorization it's using the localStorage, for now. The app is separated by components and using styled components, it's responsive.

projects.title: UX Design for a Movie Theater
projects.subtitle: mobile ticketing app for a movie theater
projects.description: Movie theater app is a mobile app that allows you to buy movie tickets for a specific cinema in the city of Barcelona, offers discounts and packs of snacks and drinks to choose from. It's a total design of user experience (UX) including user research and design of wireframes, mockups and prototypes. The 'repository' button contains the case study that shows the entire research and design process. The project was carried out for the course of Google User Experience (UX) Design, Professional Certificate.

projects.title: UX Design for a Pet Shelter
projects.subtitle: pet adoption app
projects.description: Pet Adoption app is a responsive application that allows you to view, choose, adopt or sponsor a pet from a shelter animals. It's a total design of user experience (UX) including user research and design of wireframes, mockups and prototypes. It's design with a graceful degradation philosophy. The 'repository' button contains the case study that shows the entire research and design process. The project was carried out for the course of Google User Experience (UX) Design, Professional Certificate.

projects.title: UX Design for a City Shelter
projects.subtitle: city shelter app
projects.description: City Shelter App is a responsive web application that allows you to search for a shelter for people who need it in the city of Barcelona, look at the information on the shelter, its capacity, occupation and vacant spaces, as well as being able to register a person and reserve their space. It's a total design of user experience (UX) including user research and design of wireframes, mockups and prototypes. It's design with a progressive enhancement philosophy (mobile first). The 'repository' button contains the case study that shows the entire research and design process. The project was carried out for the course of Google User Experience (UX) Design, Professional Certificate.

projects.title: Green improvement of a web
projects.subtitle: Factoría F5
projects.description: This project was carried out as the final work of the Green Digital Skills Certificate, the objective of this study is to measure the landing page of the Factoría F5 organization's web page, generate an improvement plan and develop a replica from the original page (at educational level) to compare the initial and final carbon footprint, after following some recommendations, without compromising its design and quality. The original page is developed in Wordpress and the replica in React.js, so it will also be possible to have a comparison between technologies, it will only be measured in the desktop version. In the prototype link is the entire analysis.
